definition: in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
words/speech/to say/to talk
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: From now on you are the official Statue of Liberty of this street.
sentences.chinese: 从今以后，你就是这条街上名正言顺的自由神像。

sentences.english: Protection for domestic industry is admittedly discriminatory .
sentences.chinese: 保护本国工业是种名正言顺的歧视。

sentences.english: In order to be right and proper three guns and bonuses, Chen wants to get married.
sentences.chinese: 为了更加的名正言顺，陈三炮想要和花红成亲。

sentences.english: Even with his hand to be right and proper.
sentences.chinese: 即使不能跟他名正言顺的牵着手逛街。

definition: (of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred
pinyin: ming2 bu5 zheng4 yan2 bu5 shun4

definition: (of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
just and honorable
logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
lit. to have sufficient reason to send troops (idiom)/to do something with good reason/to have just cause
a person's status
overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
to look favorably on sth/would be glad see it happen
to give a nod of approval
to be on an equal footing
lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
to accept tacitly/acquiescence
to be in a position of power
